author: bef7103
title: Wine open market - Stappato
description: O acesso ao vinho pode ser um desafio: alocações e listas de espera são notoriamente difíceis de entrar e restringir a participação no mercado

f6_assessments.q0: Não está muito claro aqui como fazer a ponte entre a venda de vinhos e o ecossistema Cardano. Os proponentes pretendem criar uma Dapp, que seria uma plataforma de comercialização de vinhos, utilizando contratos inteligentes. Mas para que seriam usados esses contratos, exatamente? Poderiam ser os dados de venda? Quais dados? O que exatamente estaria sendo hospedado em nossa rede de blockchain? Quais seriam as vantagens disso para os produtores de vinho? Em certo momento, os proponentes dizem que um dos objetivos é "integrar novas vinícolas ao projeto, mostrando-lhes as vantagens do acesso aberto a seus vinhos". Seria importante para eles definir na própria proposta quais seriam essas vantagens. Além disso, quais são os benefícios para os consumidores finais? Creio que o público-alvo são pessoas de classe alta com uma faixa etária mais avançada, geralmente são pessoas que consomem vinhos mais refinados. Este público não é o público com o qual estamos acostumados a lidar em nossos projetos - na maioria das vezes, o nosso objetivo é alcançar pessoas que já utilizam tecnologia de cadeia de bloqueio (pessoas que já têm conhecimento do campo tecnológico e interesse no mundo criptográfico); ou mesmo usuários em potencial, que têm maior probabilidade de utilizar os serviços do ecossistema Cardano. Mas o público aqui parece ser diferente, realmente, pessoas que não esperamos ter qualquer tipo de conexão com o Cardano. Como fazer este público entender as vantagens presentes aqui, como convencê-lo a deixar o tradicional e usar estas novas tecnologias? Por causa de tantas dúvidas, infelizmente, não creio que a proposta seja tão garantida de funcionar, ou seja, criar um Dapp que aumente o número de transações em Cardano e traga novos usuários para nosso ecossistema. É um projeto de nicho muito específico, e precisaria de uma melhor argumentação sobre os pontos que levantei. Se houvesse explicações sobre 1) como isso beneficiaria Cardano, em mais detalhes 2) como os produtores e consumidores se convenceriam a usar a cadeia de bloqueio, a confiança no impacto provavelmente seria muito maior.
f6_assessments.q1: Sabemos muito pouco sobre esta equipe, tudo o que nos dizem é que eles são três pessoas com experiência no negócio do vinho e também com conhecimento sobre a cadeia de bloqueio. No entanto, isto é muito pouco! Precisaríamos saber seus nomes, o que cada um faz, uma breve história do trabalho anterior e, sobretudo, como essas pessoas se relacionam com o ecossistema Cardano. Eles afirmam que existem profissionais com experiência em cadeias de bloqueios - mas como seria essa experiência? Você já fez algum projeto em Cardano antes? Se sim, qual deles? Infelizmente, não há como confiar em uma equipe que mal conhecemos. Sugiro que os concorrentes incluam descrições detalhadas e individualizadas de cada um, de preferência com exemplos de trabalhos anteriores e se houver também perfis interligados. Há um roteiro aqui, mas é superficial. Por exemplo, os primeiros 3 meses seriam dedicados à criação da plataforma para mostrá-la aos produtores, certo? Eles sabem O QUE seria feito com que OBJETIVO, mas COMO? Que atividades seriam desenvolvidas cronologicamente e por quem, a fim de obter tal produto? Também acho que 3 meses é bastante longo; seria mais interessante se as atividades fossem divididas e organizadas mensalmente, por exemplo. Um ponto que me preocupa muito aqui é o seguinte: "consultor externo em tempo parcial com experiência em negócios de vinho (~1 dia/semana por 3 meses 1500 USD/mês)". Estaríamos pagando uma pessoa para trabalhar apenas 1 dia por semana neste projeto, ou seja, aproximadamente 4 dias de trabalho que custariam USD 1500? Eu achei este valor muito alto, incompatível com o tempo de trabalho. Muitos profissionais de outras propostas trabalham em tempo integral para receber tal salário, sejam projetistas, desenvolvedores, publicitários, etc. Isto é um pouco desproporcional, em minha opinião. Com relação ao orçamento, ele é explicado juntamente com o roteiro. Em cada etapa, nos é dito quanto custariam as atividades relatadas. Em relação a este ponto, creio que temos informações suficientes para entender o financiamento, minha observação aqui é apenas que (em minha opinião) alguns valores são justos, mas outros são desproporcionais, como foi o caso comentado anteriormente. Portanto, em conclusão: 1) não há como confiar na equipe porque há pouca informação sobre eles 2) o roteiro é superficial, mas permite uma visão do todo 3) o orçamento é compreensível, mas desproporcional em algumas partes.
f6_assessments.q2: A auditabilidade aqui é boa, porque o autor da proposta esboça alguns KPIs que servem para monitorar os resultados diretos da plataforma: número de consumidores, fornecedores, produtos vendidos... Estes são dados puramente quantitativos, mas indicariam de forma concisa se o projeto foi ou não bem sucedido. Também seria ótimo se houvesse algum tipo de análise de quantos contratos inteligentes foram gerados, qual foi o impacto direto para o ecossistema Cardano? Esta parte é pouco explorada na proposta como um todo, e também na métrica final. É possível acompanhar o desenvolvimento do projeto com base no roteiro fornecido. Mas, como mencionei, sem muitos detalhes e com uma ampla divisão temporal de vários meses compilada, além do fato de que não sabemos quem faria o quê, não é possível realizar um monitoramento tão específico. Portanto, minha sugestão é que o autor defina alguma métrica (KPI) totalmente centrada em Cardano e que o roteiro seja mais detalhado. Precisamos ter contato tanto com o vendedor quanto com o desenvolvedor em Cardano, para entender como as facetas completas do projeto estariam sendo desenvolvidas. É possível auditar a proposta, mas isto poderia ser feito de forma ainda mais satisfatória se os dados comentados fossem criados, revisados e melhorados.

f6_assessments.q0:
Embora o problema citado seja compreensível, não há informações suficientes para explicar a dimensão do problema. Qual é a dimensão do mercado vitivinícola? Que dificuldades existem no mercado que poderiam ser resolvidas através de uma cadeia de bloqueio?

Posso ver potencial para um mercado de vinho, mas a proposta de valor desta proposta não está bem estabelecida.

As métricas apresentadas permitiriam medir o número de clientes, vinícolas e itens vendidos, mas não foram estabelecidas metas/KPIs que permitissem a avaliação do potencial de impacto.

Sem esclarecer os pontos acima, não há como fazer uma avaliação de impacto precisa, portanto, eu recomendaria incluir estes pontos.
f6_assessments.q1:
Não há informações suficientes para avaliar a qualificação da equipe, não sabemos sequer os nomes das pessoas envolvidas nesta proposta. Apesar de haver menção de experiência nos campos da cadeia de bloqueio e do vinho, não há nenhuma fonte ou link para apoiar estas informações. Quem será responsável pelo desenvolvimento de contratos inteligentes?

O plano do projeto foi dividido em 3 fases, mas há poucos detalhes que indicam a viabilidade. Não há informações sobre o desenvolvimento de contratos inteligentes e quem irá desenvolvê-los. A Fase 1 terá um MVP, mas eu recomendaria que a equipe trabalhasse mais sobre a lógica para justificar a idéia/conceito, pois a forma como a proposta foi apresentada não tem informações suficientes para indicar a viabilidade.

O orçamento não está bem definido. A proposta está pedindo 10.000 USD e há menção de custos para contratar um vendedor por 1.500 USD, um consultor por 1.500 USD por 3 meses e 1.500 USD para marketing (com base nestes valores como chegar a 10.000 USD?), mas nenhum destes custos envolve o desenvolvimento de uma dapp e considerando que o objetivo do desafio é o desenvolvimento da dapp não faz sentido que a proposta peça dinheiro apenas para itens fora do escopo principal do desafio. O principal ponto para julgar a viabilidade do orçamento é compreender o custo para o desenvolvimento da dapp e, embora a equipe tenha mencionado que ela cobrirá os custos adicionais, este não é um argumento para apoiar a viabilidade.

Os riscos e desafios da proposta não foram considerados. Antes de criar um mercado de vinho, seria importante conhecer o potencial, a demanda deste mercado e qual seria o apelo da criação de um mercado na cadeia de bloqueio. Estes vinhos serão certificados/autenticados pela cadeia de bloqueio? Existe a intenção de criar um modelo de cadeia de abastecimento? Existe a intenção de utilizar metadados? Se os vinhos forem certificados através da cadeia de bloqueio, quais seriam os mecanismos para evitar fraudes entre os dados incluídos na cadeia de bloqueio e o próprio vinho?

A idéia em si é válida e um mercado estaria dentro do escopo do desafio, mas eu recomendaria que a equipe fornecesse mais detalhes para que seja possível avaliar a viabilidade da proposta adequadamente.
f6_assessments.q2:
O problema não foi bem descrito, eu recomendaria fornecer mais dados e informações para entender a proposta de valor do uso da cadeia de bloqueio Cardano para o mercado de vinho. A solução apresentada não mostra informações suficientes sobre o plano técnico relativo ao desenvolvimento de contratos inteligentes.

As métricas descritas são úteis para entender o uso da cadeia de bloqueio, mas como não foram estabelecidas metas/KPIs, a auditabilidade se torna extremamente subjetiva.

Embora exista um plano com um cronograma estabelecido, considero o plano apresentado como um esboço, pois não há informações sobre como os contratos inteligentes serão utilizados e o próprio plano de negócios é muito subjetivo.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal would be a good innovation towards the Cardano blockchain, and it would gain attraction on new users as well as current users. This is because, 1) The wine market only in the U.S alone have a market worth of $88 billion. 2) Deploying smart contracts are considered a simplicity for both consumers and sellers (Though bugs, errors or malicious actors can trigger undesirable results that are hard to correct.) 3) The involvement of traditional markets into the blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1: With the given experience and connections, I believe this will an interesting project for the Cardano ecosystem to provide wineries into the blockchain, though elaboration of the hiring of team members can be further informed - but the proposer only requires funding on the marketing side. I would also like to add on the Phase 2, (what are the risks when onboarding new wineries into the project?). As it will also add as a good point to where the expansion of the project to success.
f6_assessments.q2: The funding required is only for marketing purposes and seems reasonable, and I am thrilled that the project will be implemented in the blockchain. Though, further elaboration on outreach campaigns and milestones for the marketing would be helpful to give a glimpse of the Wine Open Market. I believe it would be revolutionary to provide wineries or maybe in the future other types of spirits into the blockchain whereby users can directly buy it via smart contracts.

f6_assessments.q0: It isn't clear how much value and users this app. will bring to Cardano. Please give more information about the waiting lists for buying directly from wineries, as this isn't something many people have experience with. How will the trade platform work? Will there be buy/sell orders?
f6_assessments.q1: Who are the team members? What previous achievements can you show? It seems that you're determined to make this project work; it might be helpful to complete the MVP and then ask for funding.
f6_assessments.q2: There are simple KPIs which are measurable and realistic.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer wants to build a platform to enabe wine lovers to be treated more fair when buying wine directly from producers. A dapp will be built so the project is in line with the challenge. There's an implicit benefit for the cardano ecosystem so no problems there. The key metrics make sense for such a proposal tracking the adoption of the platform once made. I'm not sure if the project will be capable of scaling because no team members are directly specified. And I don't think the types of members mentioned will be enough to bring the project to it's success once scaling is necessary. I see quite a bit of things missing in the proposal: an understandable budget, any kind of proof for stated skills, thought about reusing what's already been done and open sourced, probing for partnerships or talks with producers and a couple of other minor things like supply chain management research, price points, competitiveness.  As a developer, I was expecting more detail. With all due respect, this looks like an idea and not a business plan. Overall a good idea that fits with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately I couldn't find any evidence of the mentioned skills in the proposal. This brings down the credability of the project alongside the fact there are details missing in the proposal. I didn't understand the budget break down, there was some mention of 3 months 1500 which makes 4500 and then 3 months of 1300 which makes 8400 and 1500 for marketing making 9900 in total, but the budget is 10000 so I didn't see where the last 100$ are. I hope the proposer wasn't rounding up and just made a mistake in calculating the end cost. I encourage the proposer to come back for the next funding rounds and take better care when compiling the proposal keeping in mind the proposal requirements. Putting yourself in the eyes of the voter is also a good idea when writing a proposal. Overall there were a couple of more things missing in the proposal that I already mentioned. Keeping in mind all said things I'd advise the author to take a look at other proposals and look at how does a proposal that is already funded look like. A good idea, but I couldn't call it feasible for the aforementioned reasons.        Taking in potential risks like competition also seems like a reasonable thing to do.
f6_assessments.q2: No mention of any way to trace the progress of the project. I'd suggest a telegram channel or some other medium to keep the community involved as they could be future customers of the app. Metrics and KPIs seem good, but that's not enough to make a good proposal. The roadmap is a bit hectic, but it's structured. The description of the problem and solution are understandable.   Overall an idea that needs more work in order to turn into a serious proposal IMO. Good luck!

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal intends to create an online marketplace and cut out the middleman that takes margins on sales transactions. What is proposed is basically like an online cooperative which wineries can join and where consumers can buy wine. So it should be profitable for both producer and consumer. If successful, it could generate additional transactions on the Cardano blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal speaks of a 'blockchain professional', which I suppose will build the smart contract. The unbacked relative experience that is claimed would suffice to run the business. But who would create the online marketplace and website? 
To enhance the feasibility and community trust in this proposal, consider publishing the team's identity and some proof of experience.
f6_assessments.q2:
While there is a clear roadmap, plan and KPIs included in the proposal, there is no information on what would happen if the project initially turns out to be not as successful as anticipated. Is there a plan b to mitigate this risk if it were to occur? 
This in combination with details on what is intended with the marketing campaign (online advertising, tv ads, ...) and a website where additional information could be found would improve the auditability of this proposal greatly.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea is about filling the demand and supply gap between wine consumers and producers using Blockchain smart contract functionalities. This is a project that has the potential great use case globally and more adoption of the ecosystem. It definitely address the campaign challenge and should he be given a chance.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has already brought the project to a realistic level and they are just asking for funds to promote the platform and for administrative costs. I am convinced that the proposal will definitely be implemented successfully. Also considering the detailed milestones and realistic budget request and the project has a great chance for a successful launch. However no challenges or risk factors had been mentioned, I still believe that the team has enough passion to ensure success.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has given considerable information to assess and the progress of the proposal if funded.

f6_assessments.q0: As an experienced Technical builder and Active Catalyst member, coming from one of the TOP wine producer countries in the world I found this proposal aligned with the Challenge objectives, as implementing the smart contract in the trading platform will drive more usage and increase transactions in the Cardano Blockchain. Though its impact is not clear as no much information was provided in order to clearly assess that. As the proposal is aimed to support the validation of an MVP and business model in the market it does makes sense that this information will be better understood once that model is validated.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team brief description seems to be appropriate for the successful achievement of the project goals for this phase, though no specific details or external reference links were provided in order to further validate those capabilities. As the requested funds will be used to fund Sales/Marketing/Customer Validation I don't see there will be too much problem to carry out the desired goals, but no information was presented on the technical side as well, on how and whom will produce the prototype/MVP and wether those members of the team are already identified or hired.
The timeline is clear but not detailed, and we are talking about an MVP in 3 months, so I'd add many more details and deliverables to the project in order for others to assess if the plan fits the purpose and what type of platform/complexity will be built.
No details on the Business Model or Platform operation were provided, besides that it seems to be a double sided platform with a Smart Contract, I'd recommend to add those details so anyone can understand what is behind the idea, to form an opinion on its chances of success.
I do value the expressed commitment that you will fund the building of the project on your own, that's great but not enough to reach the success of the project if what is being built is not the proper platform, and to understand that more details are needed.
The requested budget breakdown was provided and makes sense with its intended usage and market prices and seems reasonable for a Prototype (at least with what I imagine with the information provided)
No risks were identified within the proposal and there will be many to be addressed in the way.
I recommend to add all of these details to produce a complete proposal presentation weather you are voted and funded, so you can provide progress reports (they will be needed) and if not voted to participate in the next funding round, loved the idea to disintermediate the wine industry.
f6_assessments.q2: Even though a general goal of delivering an MVP and support the validation with the funds, no specific KPIs were provided, so it will be hard for the community to be able to audit the progress of the project. I recommend to add SMART KPIs in enough details within the 3 months project period to be able to measure and audit progress. General Production KPIs will also be great to have to understand the level of impact this project can/aim to produce.

f6_assessments.q0: The tracking of wine, like other merchandise is something that blockchain should play a big future role in. This app in particular is set to make it easier to get on the list to be able to purchase and distribute directly from wineries in a fair manner which I think is great. There are a lot of wineries in Italy, my concern currently with how much impact it will have is that they dont appear to have any direct communication with a winery at this time which would be a great way to get started in knowing that this is something that is important to the wineries in their area.
f6_assessments.q1: There is mention that the team has blockchain experience but there is a lack of information on exactly what they worked on in the past or links to previous projects and repositories. It would also be a good idea to attach member linkedin profiles or similar.
f6_assessments.q2: I think the milestones that they came up with are well thought out and are achievable. I think the rationale for the salaries could use some additional work. For example with the part time external consultant, are you saying they will work 1 day per week and for each of the 3 months they would get 1500 usd? that seems quite high for roughly 4 days of work in the month. Its possible Im misunderstanding but some clarification on that would be appreciated.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal do achieve the challenge goal. Which is bringing more users to the platform (which runs in the ADA environment).
It has a potential to make a huge impact, since according to Fortune Business Insights  [https://www.fortunebusinessinsights.com/wine-market-102836], it has a projected grow to USD 456,76 bi in 2028. Therefore, if this platform could get 0,5% of its market, its a volume of USD 2 bi in 2028, which is huge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal did not show the reference and links that shows the team experience. It would be good having this info.
About the budget, I’ve not understood it quite well. I’m missing a more broken down information. Since you’re using the money just for marketing and sales, it should be added where are you intending to advertise, for example, for how long and which methods are going to be used to do it and check its reach.
The timetable seems fair to develop what you’re proposing.
One point that I’m missing is the logistic strategy. I’m wondering here if you’re going to be only a platform which connects the seller and buyer or you’re planning to have some logistics solutions. I’ve seen this site here (https://www.liv-ex.com) which looks like your proposal, however they have some warehouses to implement logistics. Here in Brazil we have some fidelity clubs which send different wines every month to the subscribers, but they too have their own logistic net (or they provide this service, not having the actual places). Therefore, you might find that providing this service to the seller is a way to increase their participation.
Would be great to have a risk map, considering marketing effectiveness, logistics (is it going to sell all around the world?), seller stock, etc.
f6_assessments.q2:
It should be added some more KPIs like volume of transactions, number of countries supplied, etc. It would help to track the development of the platform.
Moreover, since it was not defined the advertising methods, it’s quite hard to verify its effectiveness and audit it, needing more information (method, platform, tracking, etc).

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea is valid but some points in the proposal could be clearer. First, its not clear how this application would leverage blockchain and smart contract technolgies in relation to regular market place or plataform for wine selling. More details on this could be given.
Second, its also not mentioned the potential market for this business, which makes it difficult to assess its full impact. for instance, it says, waiting list are hard to get into, but it could also say how many people are trying to get on these lists and how many there are in the lists. However, I particularly like that the business development part will happen in paralell from the technical development. It would be nice also to see the business model that is being thought for this DApp or how it intend to get revenue from. It could be from a monthly subscribe fee, transaction fee, etc.
I'd also provide more information on communication strategy to target audience. How will they be reached and what kinds of advertising would be made?

Impotant to say that proposal is aligned with challenge as it will likely increase "Number/growth of application output", "Number/growth of application transactions", Total "volume of Ada involved in application transactions" and other challenge KPIs.

In general, the idea is good but proposal could better explore the advatnages of smart contract (specially for those not very familiar with it) and the total impact, considering number of potential users.
f6_assessments.q1:
There are very few information about the team. It only mentions that 3 people are committed and their general experience, with some vague terms (as wine world connections). To make this part better strucutured, it would be imporant to see their individual capabilities and experience, have linkk to verify the information and bring more concrete example. For istance, when it is mentiones "wine world connection", it could say with whom is this connection and what level of connection is this, if any toher project was already developed with them, etc.


The plan is sound as it is time-framed and contain acitivites and deliverables. Again, much appreciated that business development happens together with technical development. I also liked that a MVP will be done first. Theres also a fair budget breakdown distribuited in the timeline.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are milestones in the timeline and 3 KPIs defined. It would be imporant though, to see some targets spread out in time, to check its evolution and see if its going accordin to plan.
Other possible metric to add is someway to measure the number of reccurrent purchases from same costumer. This could give som insight on the quality of the service as a whole (wine + platform).

In regard to risk analsysis, I'd consider both technical and business risks to be addressed have a mitigation startegy in place since begining.

solution: Desenvolver uma plataforma comercial aberta para os direitos de compra de vinho diretamente dos produtores, permitindo um acesso mais amplo e justo e maior liquidez
experience: Equipe de 3 pessoas com vários anos de experiência na indústria, incluindo profissionais da cadeia de bloqueio e sommelier graduados + conexões mundiais de vinho
